notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: NCCIC/ICS-CERT recommends that users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-17-012-01 - Web Scraped Version

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

notes.text: To be able to exploit the SQL injection vulnerability, an attacker must supply malformed input to the WebAccess software. Successful attack could result in administrative access to the application and its data files.CVE-2017-5154 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Advantech has produced WebAccess Version 8.2 that mitigates these vulnerabilities. The new version can be downloaded at http://www.advantech.com/industrial-automation/webaccess.
ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.

ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS‑CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.

notes.text: By accessing a specific uniform resource locator (URL) on the web server, a malicious user is able to access pages unrestricted.CVE-2017-5152 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.1 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Advantech has produced WebAccess Version 8.2 that mitigates these vulnerabilities. The new version can be downloaded at http://www.advantech.com/industrial-automation/webaccess.
ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.

ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS‑CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
